1.text: Set aside an enclosed container to serve as a habitat for your ladybug.

2.text: Put down some sticks, rocks, or shells to give your ladybug a place to hide.

3.text: Feed your ladybug small amounts of raisins, lettuce, or honey every day.

4.text: Place a damp paper towel or sponge inside your habitat as a water source.

5.text: Release your ladybug after a few days so it can thrive in its natural habitat.

6.text: Look for ladybugs in places with lush growth.

7.text: Scoop up your ladybug gently by hand for a simple solution.

8.text: Use a net to sweep or “beat” for large numbers of ladybugs at once.

9.text: Craft your own simple ladybug feeder to make the bugs come to you.

10.text: Lure ladybugs in after dark using a makeshift light tent.

11.text: Store your ladybug in a box or jar until you can set up a habitat for it.
